metadata.title: CVE-2022-1016 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel innet/netfilter/nf_tables_core.c:nft_do_chain, which can cause ause-after-free. This issue needs to handle 'return' with properpreconditions, as it can lead to a kernel information leak problem causedby a local, unprivileged attacker.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1016` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-lowlatency - 4.4.0-239.273~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1117-aws - 4.4.0-1117.123
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1142-azure - 4.15.0-1142.156~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-239.273~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1117.123').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1142.156~14.04.1').
